translation: współsprawca [a person who helps someone else to commit a crime or to do something morally wrong]
sentence: The thieves and two accomplices made away with over $25,000 in cash.

translation: w toku, w realizacji [happening or being planned or prepared]
sentence: There are plans afoot to launch a new radio station.

translation: poruszony [showing in your behavior that you are anxious and nervous]
sentence: She became very agitated when her son failed to return home.

translation: zdumienie, osłupienie [a feeling of great surprise]
sentence: To my amazement, he ate the whole pie.

translation: sympatyczy, miły [pleasant; friendly and easy to like]
sentence: So amiable was the mood of the meeting that a decision was soon reached.

translation: postawienie w stan oskarżenia [a legal process in a law court where someone is accused of a particular crime and asked to say if they are guilty or not]
sentence: She was in custody last night awaiting arraignment.

translation: szydło [a small pointed tool used for making holes, especially in leather]
sentence: Some of the bones have been modified into tools such as awls and points.

translation: roztrząsać, wałkować [to explain something more than necessary]
sentence: There's no need to belabor the point.

translation: świadczyć o czymś [literary; to suggest or show]
sentence: His letter bespeaks his willingness to help.

translation: wpadka, gafa [a serious mistake, usually caused by not taking care or thinking]
sentence: He said that the tax was a major political blunder.

translation: ryk (osła) [to make the loud noise typical of a donkey]
sentence: The mules suddenly started braying.

translation: napocząć [to begin a discussion of something difficult]
sentence: At some point we've got to discuss money but I don't know how to broach the subject with him.

translation: padlina [the decaying flesh of dead animals]
sentence: It feeds chiefly on fruit and roots, but kills sheep, goats, deer, ponies and cattle, and sometimes devours carrion.

translation: zaćma [a disease in which an area of someone's eye becomes less clear so that they cannot see clearly, or the area affected in this way]
sentence: He cannot even be treated for cataracts because of feared internal head injuries.

translation: okrężny [formal; (of a route or journey) long and not direct]
sentence: He took us on a circuitous route to the hotel.

translation: omijać, obchodzić, przechytrzyć [formal; to find a way of avoiding a difficulty or a rule]
sentence: They found a way of circumventing the law.

translation: klarnet
sentence: The clarinet joins the oboe and is similarly out of synchronization.

translation: zakamarek, szczelina [a small, narrow opening in something solid]
sentence: There were small plants growing in every nook and cranny of the wall.

translation: półksiężyc [(something with) a curved shape that has two narrow pointed ends, like the moon when it is less than half of a circle]
sentence: The moon was a brightly shining crescent.

translation: zrazić, zniechęcić [to make someone feel slightly frightened or worried about their ability to achieve something]
sentence: She was not at all daunted by the size of the problem.

translation: odkładać, odraczać, oppóźniać [to delay something until a later time]
sentence: The department deferred the decision for six months.

translation: pokryć koszty [formal; (especially of an organization) to pay the cost of something]
sentence: The company will defray all your expenses, including car rental.

translation: pilny, pracowity [careful and using a lot of effort]
sentence: Their lawyer was extremely diligent in preparing their case.

translation: diecezja [an area controlled by a bishop]
sentence: The king wanted to know the exact number of recusants in each diocese.

translation: deprecjonować, wypowiadać się lekceważąco [formal; to criticize someone or something in a way that shows you do not respect or value him, her, or it]
sentence: The actor's work for charity has recently been disparaged in the press as an attempt to get publicity.

translation: zakłócać [to make it difficult for something to continue in the normal way]
sentence: Demonstrators succeeded in disrupting the meeting.

translation: zniekształcać [to change the shape of something so that it looks strange or unnatural]
sentence: The map distorted Greenland to appear four times its actual size.

translation: uśpiony [not active or growing now but able to become active or to grow in the future]
sentence: During the winter the seeds lie dormant in the soil.

translation: przygębiony, przybity
sentence: I thought you were looking a little downcast this morning.

translation: buczenie, brzęczenie [a low continuous noise that does not change its note]
sentence: Outside the tent I could hear the constant drone of insects.

translation: nieuk [old-fashioned; a person who is slow to learn or stupid, especially at school]
sentence: And the woman who wrote this, whoever she is, isn't any dunce.

translation: łajno, gnój [solid waste from animals, especially cattle and horses]
sentence: The dung produced as a result was more fertile than ordinary types.

translation: dziwny, niesamowity [strange in a frightening and mysterious way]
sentence: She heard the eerie noise of the wind howling through the trees.

translation: wiąz
sentence: The avenues were planted with elm.

translation: godło [a picture of an object that is used to represent a particular person, group, or idea]
sentence: A rose is the national emblem of England.

translation: ucieleśniać [formal; to express or represent an idea or a quality]
sentence: He embodies the values of hard work and fair play.

translation: grawerować [to cut words, pictures, or patterns into the surface of metal, stone, etc.]
sentence: The jeweller skilfully engraved the initials on the ring.

translation: nim, przed [literary; before]
sentence: I shall be back ere nightfall.

translation: wypatroszyć [formal; to remove one or all of the organs from the inside of a body]
sentence: Each mouse carcass was skinned, eviscerated and digested.

translation: rozwodzić się nad czymś, rozwlekać się [formal disapproving; to speak or write about something in great detail or for a long time]
sentence: She expatiated on her work for the duration of the meal.

translation: przekleństwo [formal; a word, especially an offensive word, that you use when you are angry or in pain]
sentence: He dropped the book on his foot and muttered several expletives under his breath.

translation: zwód [(especially in sports) a movement that is intended to make your opponent think you are going to do one thing when you are really going to do something else]
sentence: He produced a brilliant feint, passed two defenders, and smashed the ball into the net.

translation: pchła
sentence: The dog has fleas.

translation: student pierwszego roku
sentence: He's a freshman at Harvard.

translation: gmerać, grzebać [to do something awkwardly, especially when using your hands]
sentence: He fumbled in his pockets for some change. I fumbled with the lock.

translation: gama [the whole range of things that can be included in something]
sentence: In her stories she expresses the whole gamut of emotions, from happiness to sorrow.

translation: głębokie nacięcie, blizna [a long, deep cut in the surface of something, especially a person's skin]
sentence: He needed an operation to close a nasty gash in his arm.

translation: łapać dech z trudem [to take a quick deep breath with your mouth open, especially because you are surprised or in pain]
sentence: They gasped in astonishment at the news.

translation: poryw wiatru, podmuch [a sudden strong increase in the amount and speed of wind that is blowing]
sentence: A gust of wind blew his hat off.

translation: oklepany [used too often and therefore boring]
sentence: The plot of the film is just a hackneyed boy-meets-girl scenario.

translation: utrudniać, zawadzać [to prevent someone doing something easily]
sentence: Our efforts were severely hampered by a lack of money.

translation: szybko, ochoczo [informal; very quickly and without delay]
sentence: She'd come hotfoot from the palace with the latest news.

translation: pędzić [to move very fast, especially in a way that seems dangerous]
sentence: The truck came hurtling towards us.

translation: nie na miejscu, absurdalny, osobliwy [formal; unusual or different from what is around or from what is generally happening; strange, and not suitable in a particular situation]
sentence: It seems incongruous to have a woman as the editor of a men's magazine.

translation: osoba sprawująca urząd [formal; officially having the named position]
sentence: The incumbent president faces problems which began many years before he took office.

translation: wpajać, wzbudzać [to gradually make someone feel, think, or behave in a particular way over a period of time]
sentence: He's a coach with great skill at instilling confidence into his players.

translation: internować, uwięzić [to put someone in prison for political or military reasons, especially during a war]
sentence: Many foreigners were interned for the duration of the war.

translation: nieustraszony [extremely brave and showing no fear of dangerous situations]
sentence: Intrepid travelers can stay the night at Volcano House, located along the rim of Kilauea.

translation: niezbity, niezaprzeczalny [formal; that cannot be proved wrong and that must therefore be accepted]
sentence: Both strategies can apparently be justified by simple and apparently irrefutable arguments.

translation: rozpychać się, przepychać [to knock or push roughly against someone in order to move past them or get more space when you are in a crowd of people]
sentence: Photographers jostled and shoved to get a better view of the royal couple.

translation: poranić, pokaleczyć [formal; to cut or tear something, especially flesh]
sentence: The man's face was severely lacerated in the accident.

translation: spiżarnia [a cupboard or small room used, especially in the past, for storing food in someone's home]
sentence: The houses will consist of four rooms, kitchen, scullery, larder, wash-house, and sanitary accommodation.

translation: przejrzysty, przytomny [clearly expressed and easy to understand, or (of a person) thinking or speaking clearly]
sentence: She gave a clear and lucid account of her plans for the company's future.

translation: żałobny, ponury [literary; looking or sounding sad and dismal]
sentence: We were assured in almost lugubrious tones that the submarines were a menace.

translation: morski [formal; connected with human activity at sea]
sentence: Amalfi and Venice were important maritime powers.

translation: wesołość, rozbawienie [literary; happiness, fun, and the sound of people laughing]
sentence: The performance produced much mirth among the audience.

translation: zamęt, mętlik [a situation of confusion or bad organization]
sentence: There was a big muddle over who was buying the tickets.

translation: mimo wszystko [formal; (also used following the noun it refers to) without being affected by something; despite something]
sentence: Notwithstanding some major financial problems, the school has had a successful year.

translation: jądro [the central part of an atom, usually made up of protons and neutrons; the part of a cell that controls its growth]
sentence: DNA is stored in the nucleus of a cell.

translation: samorodek [a small lump of a valuable metal or mineral, especially gold, that is found in the earth]
sentence: With gold sitting just under the surface, the shallowness allowed diggers to easily unearth gold nuggets.

translation: wszechwiedzący [formal; having or seeming to have unlimited knowledge]
sentence: God is omniscient.

translation: podsłuchać [to hear what other people are saying without intending to and without their knowledge]
sentence: I overheard a very funny conversation on the bus this morning.

translation: marny, nędzny [(of an amount) too small to be considered as important or useful]
sentence: The company offered Frazer a paltry sum, which he refused.

translation: przepuszczalny [allowing a liquid or gas to pass through]
sentence: The skin of amphibians is permeable to water.

translation: wytrwałość [continued effort and determination]
sentence: Through hard work and perseverance, he worked his way up to the top.

translation: ławka kościelna [a long wooden seat with a high back, on which a row of people sit in a church]
sentence: It is like denouncing those who have come to church for the empty pews.

translation: topola
sentence: The wood normally used for the roof beams is juniper or poplar.

translation: przepowiednia złego [literary; a sign or warning of something that is going to happen in the future, especially when it is something unpleasant]
sentence: The event proved to be a portent of the disaster that was to come.

translation: sprawność, męstwo, waleczność [great skill at doing something]
sentence: What level of prowess is meant by the word musicianship?

translation: kałuża [a pool of liquid on the ground or floor, formed by filling up the holes in uneven surfaces]
sentence: You have to step around the puddles in the street after a rain shower.

translation: czyściec
sentence: They believe that while his remains are in unconsecrated ground he will remain in purgatory.

translation: abstrakcyjny, mało znany [not known about by many people and difficult to understand]
sentence: We had to work from material that was both complex and recondite.

translation: wielokrotnie powtarzać [to say something again so that people take notice of it]
sentence: I must reiterate that we have no intention of signing this contract.

translation: uchylać, znosić [to officially make a law end]
sentence: The committee does not have the power to repeal the ban.

translation: przepaść, rozłam, rozpadlina [a serious disagreement between people that stops their relationship from continuing; a large crack or opening in the ground, rocks, or clouds]
sentence: The stream had cut a deep rift in the rock. The marriage caused a rift between the brothers and they didn't speak to each other for ten years.

translation: pofalować, marszczyć [to (cause to) move in small waves]
sentence: The breeze rippled the water. His muscles rippled under his skin.

translation: spodek [a small, shallow, round dish that a cup stands on; an object that is shaped like this]
sentence: She gave the cat a saucer of milk.

translation: padlinożerca [a bird or an animal that feeds on dead animals that it has not killed itself]
sentence: Most dead birds are picked up by crows or other scavengers.

translation: skromny, unikający rozgłosu [not making yourself noticeable, or not trying to get the attention of other people]
sentence: The captain was typically self-effacing when questioned about the team's successes, giving credit to the other players.

translation: odrapany, wytarty [(of buildings, clothes, objects, etc.) in poor condition because they have been used a lot; (of a person) badly dressed in clothes that have been worn a lot]
sentence: He wore a shabby old overcoat.

translation: okiennica [one of a pair of wooden or metal covers that can be closed over the outside of a window to keep out light or protect the windows from damage]
sentence: They explored, throwing open the shutters in each of the big rooms.

translation: sapać [to breathe in quickly and repeatedly through the nose, usually because you are crying or because you have a cold]
sentence: He was snuffling and blowing his nose.

translation: rozwierać, rozkładać [to make fingers, legs, etc. become further apart from each other or spread out; to be spread out wide apart]
sentence: She lay on the bed, her arms and legs splayed out.

translation: smuga [a long thin mark or line that is a different color from the surface it is on]
sentence: The window cleaner left dirty streaks on the windows.

translation: twierdza, warownia [a building or position that is strongly defended]
sentence: The college is a stronghold of the child-centered approach to teaching.

translation: wzniosły, idealny [of very high quality and causing great admiration]
sentence: The book has sublime descriptive passages.

translation: dusić, dławić [to attack or kill someone by squeezing their throat in order to stop them from breathing]
sentence: He throttled the guard with his bare hands. The city is being throttled by traffic.

translation: nieśmiały, strachliwy [shy and nervous; without much confidence; easily frightened]
sentence: He stopped in the doorway, too timid to go in.

translation: cichy, spokojny, niezmącony [calm and peaceful and without noise, violence, worry, etc.]
sentence: She stared at the tranquil surface of the water.

translation: spływać, sączyć się [(of liquid) to flow slowly and without force]
sentence: Blood trickled from a cut in his forehead.

translation: dzielność, męstwo [literary; great courage, especially in war]
sentence: He was promoted to the rank of major in recognition of his valor during the battle.

translation: maleńki [informal; small in amount; little]
sentence: Just a wee drop of milk for me.

translation: ubijać [to mix liquids, eggs, etc. into a stiff light mass, using a fork or special tool]
sentence: Whisk the egg whites until stiff.

translation: wytrzymać, przetrwać [to be strong enough, or not be changed by something, or to oppose a person or thing successfully]
sentence: Our toys are designed to withstand the rough treatment of the average five-year-old.

translation: cis
sentence: In the middle of the churchyard stands an old yew.
